question: What do I do if I'm waiting for a disability status decision and don't have health insurance?
text:
What do I do if I'm waiting for a disability status decision and don't have health insurance?
          
        
It will take an unknown period of time to get a decision about your disability status, so it's important not to assume that you'll get Social Security Disability Insurance (SSDI).
You can apply for coverage through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace, while you wait for a disability status decision.

When you apply, you will to see if you qualify for Medicaid or for financial assistance through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace. You may qualify for Medicaid based on your income and family size.

You may qualify to enroll in a health plan through Virginia's Insurance Marketplace with
premium tax credits
and other savings that make coverage more affordable. This will depend on your household size and income.

If you get a
positive
disability decision, you may have to wait
24 months
before Medicare coverage starts. If you get a
negative
disability decision, you can still apply for coverage on Virginia's Insurance Marketplace. Answer yes when asked if you have a disability. Virginia's Insurance Marketplace will send your application to the VA Department of Medical Assistance Services to see if you qualify for Medicaid (Medical Assistance or MA).
